comments.body: hmmm... , do we want to raise an error here?
I wanted to keep the original behaviour. pop(key, None) will return None if no key found. I changed Dict to Set, but I wanted to keep the default behaviour anyway.

comments.body: What do you think about making this a property?

This could make it harder to understand the code.  Note that a loop is used below that iterates over the result of this function, but at the same time modifies self.queued_tasks). If we create a property here, it will be difficult to see that property and self.queued_task are related.

comments.body:
Celery Executor already overrides this method:

https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/2a2adb3f94cc165014d746102e12f9620f271391/airflow/executors/celery_executor.py#L244-L263

Yep celery is not broken as it does override the `trigger_tasks` to pass the queue.

The BaseExecutor should expose all the functionality (like it used to) though without having to have executors override this function? Otherwise the queue argument to `execute_async` is redundant?
